definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
circle/ring/loop/classifier for loops, orbits, laps of race etc/CL:個|个[ge4]/to surround/to circle
to confine/to lock up/to pen in

sentences.english: Throw a stone into still water and watch the ripples spread in rings .
sentences.chinese: 投一塊石頭到靜止的水裏，看漣漪盪漾成圈。

sentences.english: Never wind the packing into a coil in the stuffing box.
sentences.chinese: 絕不能將盤根盤旋成圈繞入填料函中。

sentences.english: Put the chairs in circles and we will play games.
sentences.chinese: 把椅子擺放成圈，我們要做遊戲。

definition: to join head to tail/bumper-to-bumper (of traffic jam)
to surround/to encircle/to enclose/to fence in
to wind/to coil/to spool/to loop around/winding
to twist (strands into a thread)/to entangle/to wring/to hang (by the neck)/to turn/to wind/classifier for skeins of yarn
